subject: RE: [junit] Test cases size and design
msgSnippet: In regards to testing your game pieces, might I suggest looking to parameterize your tests. Perhaps you could have an XML file that named a piece, its
messageBody:
In regards to testing your game pieces, might I suggest looking to
parameterize your tests. Perhaps you could have an XML file that
named a piece, its corresponding class, and the attributes you
are looking for. Then have the testCase read this XML file, use Java
reflection to create an instance of the class and check for the attributes.

In this way you are not writing code to test a new piece but simply
adding to the XML file.

And you might want to consider such an option for the actual game design.

Erik Husby
